```{r}
packages=c('tidyverse')
for(p in packages) {
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)){
    install.packages(p)
  }
  library(p,character.only =T)}
```

```{r}
exam_data<-read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```


#my first visualisation created using ggplot2

```{r}
ggplot(data =exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS))+
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, 
                 color="black",
                 fill="light blue")

```


##
```{r}
ggplot(data =exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           fill= GENDER))+
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,  
                 color="grey30") #this is changing the color of outline to grey

```
